events.title: Coast Guard suspends search for survivors days after narco-terrorist strikes in Eastern Pacific
events.description: The U.S. Coast Guard ended a search for survivors after strikes on suspected drug vessels in the Eastern Pacific. Three alleged narco-terrorists were killed, and others remain missing.

events.title: Parliament to be recalled early as Labor seeks to crack down on ‘hate preachers’ and fund gun buybacks
events.description: Coalition gearing up to intensify campaign for royal commission into antisemitism but may be split on tighter gun controls The federal parliament will be recalled early as the Albanese government seeks to rush through laws to crack down on “hate preachers” and fund a national gun buyback scheme in the wake of the Bondi beach alleged terrorist attack. But the government is resisting calls for a royal commission into antisemitism, as the Coalition prepares to use parliament’s return to intensify the campaign for an inquiry. Continue reading...

events.title: The rise and fall of Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro in photos
events.description: Nicolás Maduro rose from a unionized bus driver in Caracas to the presidency of Venezuela, inheriting power after the death of Hugo Chávez and consolidating it over a turbulent decade in office. Under his leadership, the nation spiraled into crisis, pushing millions into poverty and driving one of the world’s largest migration waves. International isolation and U.S.-led sanctions intensified as Maduro clung to power. ___ This is a photo gallery curated by AP photo editors.

events.title: Anthony Joshua’s driver charged with dangerous driving after fatal crash in Nigeria
events.description: British boxer was injured in collision that killed his personal trainer Latif Ayodele and strength coach Sina Ghami Nigerian police have charged Anthony Joshua’s driver with causing death by dangerous driving after a fatal crash that killed two people. Adeniyi Mobolaji Kayode, 46, was also charged with driving without a valid driving licence and “driving without due care and attention, causing bodily harm and damage to property”. He is due to appear in court on 20 January. Continue reading...

events.title: Massacre at Nigerian market leaves more than 30 dead as gunmen torch stalls, kidnap others
events.description: Armed attackers killed more than 30 people and kidnapped others during a violent market raid in Nigeria's Niger state, police said.

events.title: Trump threatens Iran as more protest deaths reported
events.description: Amid deadly protests in Iran sparked by economic woes, US President Trump warned that the regime in Tehran would be "hit very hard" by the US if more protesters were killed.

events.title: Security Council LIVE: ‘The power of the law must prevail,’ says UN chief
events.description: The Security Council is meeting in emergency session in New York to address the US rendition of Venezuela’s President Nicolás Maduro from Caracas, a move that has sent shockwaves through the region and beyond. The UN chief António Guterres told ambassadors there must be respect for national sovereignty, “political independence and territorial integrity,” after warning on Saturday that the US had set a “dangerous precedent” for the world order. Follow the historic meeting live below from the UN Meetings Coverage team, and UN News app users can click here.

events.title: Drop draft proposals on death penalty for Palestinians, UN rights chief urges Israel
events.description: The UN’s top human rights official on Friday called on Israeli authorities to abandon plans for new legislation that would impose mandatory death sentences exclusively on Palestinians, warning the proposals violate international law and fundamental human rights standards.

events.title: North Korea launches ballistic missiles towards sea before South Korean leader’s visit to China
events.description: South Korea’s military reports projectile launch hours before Lee Jae Myung was due to head to Beijing North Korea launched ballistic missiles towards the sea on Sunday, its neighbours said, just hours before South Korea’s president was due to leave for talks in China expected to cover North Korea’s nuclear programme. South Korea’s joint chiefs of staff said in a statement that they detected several ballistic missile launches from North Korea’s capital region at about 7.50am local time. They said the missiles flew about 560 miles (900km) and that South Korea and US authorities were analysing details of the launches. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump warning over Iran protests 'reckless' says foreign minister
events.description: The US president earlier said if peaceful protesters are killed, Washington "will come to their rescue".

events.title: DR Congo blames Rwanda-backed rebels for 1,500 deaths
events.description: Kinshasa says Rwanda-backed M23 rebels have killed 1,500 civilians despite a US-brokered ceasefire, as fresh clashes erupt near Uvira and tensions spill into Burundi.

events.title: Nicolas Maduro's first appearance in court on drug trafficking charges
events.description: Deposed Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro is set to make his first appearance Monday in an American courtroom on the narco-terrorism charges the Trump administration used to justify capturing him and bringing him to New York. His lawyers are expected to contest the legality of his arrest, arguing he is immune from prosecution as a sovereign head of a foreign state. But the US doesn’t recognize him as Venezuela’s legitimate leader. Analysis by Marc Perelman, France 24 international affairs editor.

events.title: Yemeni forces regain control of strategic port after days of airstrikes
events.description: Saudi-backed forces spread across Yemen's Mukalla on Sunday after retaking the port city which was seized by southern separatists last month. The capital of Hadramout province was retaken by Yemen’s internationally recognized government following days of Saudi airstrikes. Story by Nicholas Rushworth.

events.title: WHO research shows COVID vaccines still crucial in preventing severe illness
events.description: Up-to-date vaccination remains the most effective way to prevent severe COVID-19 illness, new research from the World Health Organization (WHO) shows, even as the pandemic has officially ended.

events.title: Nicolas Maduro due in US court on narco-terrorist charges
events.description: Deposed Venezuelan president Nicolas Maduro is expected to appear in a New York court on Monday, just days after being seized in Caracas in a shock US military operation that paved the path for Washington's plans to dominate the oil-rich country. Story by Solange Mougin.

events.title: WATCH: Ohio police smash sunroof, drag injured driver from burning car after rollover crash
events.description: Ohio police officers smashed through a sunroof to rescue a trapped driver from a burning car after a crash. Dramatic body camera video shows the rescue.

events.title: Delcy Rodríguez strikes conciliatory tone with US after Trump warning
events.description: Venezuela’s interim leader offers to work with US after Trump threatened that she could pay ‘very big price’ Analysis: Delcy Rodríguez must walk tightrope as Venezuela’s interim leader Venezuela’s acting president, Delcy Rodríguez , has offered to work with the US, dialing down the confrontational tone she intially adopted after the capture of the dictator Nicolás Maduro. In a statement late on Sunday, Rodríguez said she had “invited the US government to work together on an agenda of cooperation”. Continue reading...

events.title: Iran urges courts to show 'no leniency' for 'rioters' as deadly protests persist
events.description: The head of Iran's judiciary on Monday said he instructed prosecutors and the courts to offer "no leniency" to "rioters" after more than a week of protests across the country, sparked by a strike among Tehran's shopkeepers over soaring prices. At least 12 people have been killed in clashes, with US President Donald Trump vowing to hit Iran "very hard" if the authorities kill more demonstrators.

events.title: At least 30 killed and several others abducted as gunmen storm village in Nigeria
events.description: At least 30 people have been killed and several others abducted after gunmen attacked a village in Nigeria, police said.

events.title: At least 30 killed in attack on Nigeria village
events.description: It is the latest in a spate of violent attacks in Niger state, and comes a day after officials said schools could reopen following a mass abduction last year.

events.title: Why Europe bows to US influence: "The Owned Continent"
events.description: Reactions to the US attack on Caracas have been somewhat muted, notably from Europe. Most heads of state, including from EU institutions, said that they were watching the situation carefully and called for restraint and for international laws to be respected. Our EU correspondent has penned a book about the US' relationship with the EU: "The Owned Continent". He gives an assessment of Europe’s dependence on the US and describes how Donald Trump has exploited it, but he also proposes a way out.

events.title: Health advances marked 2025 as wars and funding cuts strained systems
events.description: From eliminating deadly infections to expanding access to lifesaving vaccines, 2025 delivered meaningful progress for global health, according to the UN World Health Organization (WHO), offering cautious optimism at the close of a year marked by both breakthroughs and strain.

events.title: Rubio vows to eliminate Hezbollah, Iran operations from Venezuela after Maduro capture
events.description: Hezbollah condemns U.S. capture of Nicolas Maduro as Secretary of State Marco Rubio vows to end the terrorist group's decades-long presence in Venezuela.

events.title: Rise in holiday measles infections sparks health alerts in NSW, SA and Victoria
events.description: Cases of the highly contagious virus jumped nearly threefold in 2025 as immunisation rates declined Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Health authorities across Australia are on high alert as measles cases rise across the country, fuelled by summer international travel and a decline in childhood vaccination rates. Data from the National Centre for Immunisation Research and Surveillance (NCIRS) has found that for the first time in 10 years, Australia’s early childhood vaccination coverage has slipped below the critical 95% threshold required for herd immunity. Continue reading...

events.title: Afghanistan to remain major crisis in 2026, UN, partners warn
events.description: Afghanistan is expected to remain one of the world’s largest humanitarian crises in 2026, UN agencies and humanitarian partners warned on Tuesday, launching a $1.7 billion appeal to assist nearly 18 million people in urgent need.

events.title: Israel extends Gaza occupation beyond ‘yellow line’ in north, bombs south
events.description: Israeli attacks have killed at least 414 Palestinians and injured 1,145 in daily truce violations since October 10.

events.title: UN secretary general ‘deeply concerned’ after US operation in Venezuela as Nicolás Maduro arrives at Manhattan court – live
events.description: António Guterres concerned by ‘possible intensification of instability’ of Venezuela; ousted president arrives at a Manhattan courthouse where the full list of charges will be read A UK minister would not be drawn into saying whether his government believes the US capture of Venezuela’s president was influenced by the country’s rich oil reserves . Asked on Sky News why he thought Donald Trump had captured Nicolás Maduro and said America would “run” Venezuela, Home Office minister Mike Tapp said: This is for Donald Trump to answer , and I think he has said in his press conference, which I watched with interest around narco-terrorism and that threat. Continue reading...

events.title: US energy stocks rise as Trump vows to unlock Venezuela’s oil
events.description: Oil price rises despite fears US president’s pledge could deepen global supply glut Business live – latest updates Venezuela crisis - latest updates US energy stocks rose on Monday, after Donald Trump promised to unlock Venezuela’s vast crude oil reserves following the US capture of the country’s president, Nicolás Maduro. Shares in Chevron, which already operates in Venezuela under a special licence provided by the Trump administration, rose 4% when Wall Street opened. Exxon Mobil was up 1.6%, while Halliburton, which provides products and services to the oil and gas sector, jumped 7%. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump's Maduro raid broke international law, Scottish leader suggests - as PM says US must 'set out justifications'
events.description: Scotland's first minister has suggested the US broke international law by attacking Venezuela and capturing its president.

events.title: 'Deeply shocked': World leaders react to US attack on Venezuela
events.description: There has been a mixed reaction to a large-scale strike on Venezuela and Maduro's capture by the US.

events.title: Are Trump's threats to Iran helping or harming protesters?
events.description: The US might hit Iran "very hard" if the regime escalates its crackdown on anti-government protesters, according to US President Donald Trump. How do Iranians feel about these warnings?

events.title: Ukraine updates: Deadly Russian attack hits Kyiv
events.description: An overnight Russian air attack killed at least two people in Ukraine's capital. Meanwhile, Donald Trump has said he doesn't believe Russia's claim that Ukraine attacked Putin's residence. DW has more.

events.title: Drone strike kills 1 in Russian border region ahead of Ukraine peace talks
events.description: A Ukrainian drone strike killed one person and wounded two others, including a 4-year-old child, in Russia’s Belgorod region on Sunday, officials said, ahead of peace talks in Paris this week

events.title: American jailed for billionaire’s Monaco death, plot to kill wife exposed in long con, expert says
events.description: Crime expert analyzes Ted Maher's pattern from the deadly 1999 Monaco fire that killed banker Edmond Safra to his recent murder-for-hire conviction.

events.title: Venezuela updates: Maduro arrives at New York court
events.description: The captured Venezuelan president is appearing in a New York court on narco-terrorism charges, while the UN Security Council convenes after the US attack. Follow DW for the latest.

events.title: Iran’s Khamenei lashes out at protesters as nationwide anti-regime unrest grows
events.description: Iran protests prompted Ayatollah Ali Khamenei to call demonstrators "enemy mercenaries" and "rioters" in his first public speech since nationwide unrest began seven days ago.

events.title: Police identify all 40 victims of Swiss bar fire
events.description: Among those killed by the blaze at Le Constellation is 16-year-old Swiss national Arthur Brodard, his mother confirms.

events.title: Ghanaian artist Ibrahim Mahama at top of the art world
events.description: Best known for large-scale burlap sack installations, Ibrahim Mahama is helping shift power in the art world to the Global South while redefining art as a collective practice.

events.title: Ukraine: Attacks disrupt heating as temperatures plunge
events.description: Recent attacks across Ukraine have killed civilians, damaged critical infrastructure and cut heating and power supplies for millions, UN humanitarians report, as temperatures drop below freezing.

events.title: SEE PICS: Venezuelans worldwide celebrate as exiles react to Maduro’s capture
events.description: Venezuelans erupt in celebration after President Donald Trump announces Nicolás Maduro's capture, with celebrations in Miami, Chile and Spain.

events.title: Maduro gave state TV address as US strikes in Venezuela began: report
events.description: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro called U.S. strikes an "attack against Venezuela's sovereignty" before President Donald Trump announced his capture.

events.title: Teenage boy who survived Hillcrest jumping castle tragedy killed in ebike accident in Tasmania
events.description: Lucas Reid, 15, remembered for ‘resilience and optimism’ after bike crash near Devonport on New Year’s Eve Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A teenage boy who survived the 2021 Hillcrest jumping castle incident was killed in an ebike accident on New Year’s Eve. Lucas Reid, 15, lost control of the bike and hit a pole outside Devonport, Tasmania, at about 7.30pm on Wednesday. Continue reading...

events.title: United Nations official shares scenes from Darfur region amid humanitarian crisis
events.description: The United Nations humanitarian coordinator for Sudan recounts devastating scenes and stories of horrific violence after her team gained access to a city in the embattled Darfur region.

events.title: Legal concerns surround US capture of Venezuela's Maduro
events.description: Was the US capture of Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro legal under international law? Experts say no and believe any self-defense claim by the Trump administration is unlikely to hold up.

events.title: Italy faces mounting criticism ahead of Winter Olympics
events.description: Italy is getting ready to host the Winter Olympics, known as Milan Cortina 2026. The event is an opportunity to showcase the country to the rest of the world and is being held in four Italian regions. But less than two months before the arrival of the Olympic torch, the organisers are facing serious challenges and criticism is mounting over the Games' environmental impact. Our Italy correspondents report.

events.title: Security Council: New faces, old tensions as five nations take their seats
events.description: From deploying peacekeepers to conducting quiet – but at times heated – diplomacy, the UN Security Council sits at the heart of global decision-making on war and peace. As of January, five new countries will have a seat around the iconic horseshoe table.

events.title: Thirty-two Cubans killed during US attack on Venezuela
events.description: Cuba's president said military and intelligence operatives were providing protection to captured leader Nicolás Maduro.

events.title: Tensions between Saudis and Emiratis over future of Yemen reach boiling point
events.description: Dispute has potential to create civil war in south of Yemen and spill over into neighbouring countries Tensions between the United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia over the future of Yemen and the imminent possibility of the declaration of an independent southern state have reached boiling point with Saudi Arabia in effect accusing the UAE of threatening its future security. The dispute has the potential to create a civil war within the south of Yemen and also spill over into other disputes including in Sudan and the Horn of Africa where the two countries often find themselves backing opposite sides. Yemen could yet become only one theatre in which the two vastly wealthy Gulf states vie for political influence, control of shipping lanes and commercial access. Continue reading...

events.title: Nicolás Maduro to appear in New York court on drugs and weapons charges
events.description: Venezuelan president captured by US in shocking raid is seen being led in handcuffs on his way to court The deposed Venezuelan president, Nicolás Maduro , is expected to appear in Manhattan federal court on Monday afternoon on drugs and weapons charges after his extraordinary capture by US special forces this weekend. Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, were seized in a shocking pre-dawn raid at a compound on Saturday during an assault on Caracas . At least 40 people, including civilians and Venezuelan military members, reportedly died in the attack. Continue reading...

events.title: After Venezuela attack, Cuba watches the U.S. warily
events.description: With his attack on Venezuela, President Trump says the Monroe Doctrine is back, reviving a more than 200-year-old foreign policy idea. In Cuba, residents brace for what that could mean for them.

events.title: South Korea and China seek improved ties amid state visit
events.description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung said he hoped for a "new phase" in ties with China during his state visit. Xi Jinping called for the countries to protect regional peace in a "more complex and turbulent" world.

events.title: Germany: State antisemitism commissioner's house attacked
events.description: Brandenburg's antisemitism commissioner, Andreas Büttner, said a fire was set next to his property. This was the second attack on the official in the past 16 months.

events.title: Cuba says 32 Cuban officers were killed in US operation in Venezuela
events.description: Cuba has acknowledged the deaths of 32 Cubans in the American military operation that ousted Venezuela's leader over the weekend

events.title: British and French warplanes strike suspected IS weapons facility in Syria
events.description: British and French warplanes have carried out an airstrike in central Syria, targeting an underground facility suspected of storing weapons for the Islamic State group

events.title: Indonesian rescuers find a second body as search for Spanish soccer coach and 2 children extended
events.description: Indonesian rescuers have recovered a second body in the ongoing search for a Spanish soccer coach and two of his children who went missing after a tour boat sank during their Christmas holiday

events.title: Sexual violence against children ‘entrenched, systemic and widespread’ across DR Congo, UNICEF warns
events.description: Sexual violence against children has become entrenched, systemic and increasingly widespread across the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), with new data showing a sharp rise in cases since 2022, according to the UN Children’s Fund (UNICEF).

events.title: Runner fought off mountain lion with stick just weeks before fatal attack on same Colorado trail
events.description: A Colorado hiker fought off a mountain lion with a stick after being rushed on a trail where a woman was found dead weeks later in a suspected wildlife attack.

events.title: Off-duty ICE agent takes down armed man firing rifle at LA apartment complex
events.description: Off-duty ICE agent confronted armed neighbor firing rifle shots into the air at Los Angeles apartment complex on New Year's Eve, fatally shooting the gunman.

events.title: What the US did in Venezuela normalises power grabs: Expert
events.description: US skirted international law and its own political limits in its operation in Venezuela, expert says.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro’s narco case echoes US history of targeting alleged foreign drug kingpins
events.description: From Maduro to El Chapo: How the U.S. has pursued foreign leaders allegedly involved in international drug trafficking operations over the decades.

events.title: Greece says a radio failure that grounded flights is unlikely to be a cyberattack
events.description: Greece’s transport minister says a major radio communications failure that shut the country’s airspace on Sunday is unlikely to have been a cyberattack

events.title: Yemen aid response buckling under funding cuts as needs keep rising
events.description: Yemen’s already fragile humanitarian response is being pushed to breaking point by deep funding shortfalls, the UN warned in an update Sunday highlighting mounting risks for millions across the country.

events.title: ‘Do not give up on children’: Displaced by violence, a Haitian girl finds hope at school
events.description: A teenage Haitian girl who was forced to flee her home in Haiti’s capital, Port-au-Prince, due to gang violence has urged adults not to “give up on children.”

events.title: Swiss police identify all 116 people injured in deadly New Year's bar fire
events.description: Swiss police say they've identified all the people who were injured in the fire that tore through a New Year’s celebration in a crowded bar

events.title: Gunmen raid village in Nigeria, killing at least 30 people and abducting others
events.description: Gunmen have killed at least 30 villagers and abducted several others in northern Nigeria’s Niger state, according to police

events.title: Off-duty deputy shot and killed while working security job in Texas, suspect apprehended
events.description: Off-duty Caldwell County deputy shot and killed while working security at a nightclub in Austin, Texs. Police investigation ongoing.

events.title: Tech-savvy thieves exploit obits, online posts to strike homes while families grieve, expert warns
events.description: Retired LAPD lieutenant reveals how burglars use obituaries to predict when homes are vacant, targeting families during their most vulnerable moments.

events.title: Venezuela’s Maduro to appear in New York court: What to expect
events.description: Maduro is charged with 'narcoterrorism', conspiring to import cocaine, but legal experts say his abduction is illegal.

events.title: What is the US charging Nicolas Maduro with?
events.description: Maduro and five others are charged in the US with a number of crimes, including 'narco-terrorism'.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: 25 are dead and 14 more missing after boat capsizes in Nigeria's Yobe state
events.description: A passenger boat has capsized in northern Nigeria’s Yobe state, leaving at least 25 people dead

events.title: A woman dies from cervical cancer every two minutes, UN says
events.description: A flood of questions drowned Jeanette in thought after she was diagnosed with cervical cancer. Would she be unable to conceive a child? Would she have to enter menopause at the early age of 31?

events.title: Another child dies in extreme conditions in Gaza: UNICEF
events.description: A sixth child has died in Gaza this month as the enclave’s people continue to endure dire living conditions linked to freezing rains and the Israel-Hamas war, the UN Children’s Fund (UNICEF) has announced. The development comes as aid agencies urged Israeli authorities to reconsider revoking the licences of dozens of humanitarian partners that provide assistance across the devastated enclave from 1 January.

events.title: Activist group says it was behind Berlin fire that cut power to thousands
events.description: The far-left Vulkan Gruppe says in a statement that targeting the fossil fuel economy, not cutting power, was the goal.

events.title: Denmark urges Trump to cease threats to take over Greenland
events.description: The Danish prime minister has said the US doesn't have the right to annex the territory, after Donald Trump again said the US needs Greenland for national security reasons.

events.title: After Venezuela, Colombia? Trump escalates Latin America tensions
events.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Sunday threatened military action against Colombia's government, ​telling reporters that ‍such an operation "sounds good to me." "Colombia ​is very sick, too, run by ​a sick man, who likes making cocaine and selling it to the United States, and he's not going to be doing it very long," Trump ‍told reporters aboard Air Force One, in ​an apparent reference to Colombia's President Gustavo Petro. The comments came after the United States captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro in an audacious raid and whisked him to New ‍York to face drug-trafficking charges. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Rio de Janeiro, Tim Vickery.

events.title: Donald Trump has ripped up the rule book, where could US strike next?
events.description: After his sending in troops to capture Venezuelan president Nicolas Maduro and pledging to "run" his country, it seems Donald Trump may not be done.

events.title: Sudan: UN warns of unprecedented child hunger in Darfur as fighting fuels refugee exodus
events.description: Sudan’s deepening war is driving unprecedented levels of hunger, child malnutrition and displacement, UN agencies report, as new data from Darfur and a renewed refugee influx into Chad underscore the rapidly deteriorating situation.

events.title: South Korea's 'movie of the year' is an indie story about a teen's trauma
events.description: The World of Love has been praised for its touching, empathetic portrayal of life after sexual assault.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Cremation pyre in Africa thought to be world’s oldest containing adult remains
events.description: 9,500-year-old pyre uncovered in Malawi offers rare insight into rituals of ancient African hunter-gatherer groups A cremation pyre built about 9,500 years ago has been discovered in Africa, offering a fresh glimpse into the complexity of ancient hunter-gatherer communities. Researchers say the pyre, discovered in a rock shelter at the foot of Mount Hora in northern Malawi, is thought to be the oldest in the world to contain adult remains, the oldest confirmed intentional cremation in Africa, and the first pyre to be associated with African hunter-gatherers. Continue reading...

events.title: T20 World Cup cricket: Why Bangladesh won’t travel to India
events.description: A month before the tournament begins, Bangladesh have said they will not play T20 World Cup matches in India. The decision comes on the back of political and sporting tensions between the countries.

events.title: Do countries really need fossil fuels to develop?
events.description: Rich nations built their wealth on coal, oil and gas. Now the world is asking poorer countries like Mozambique to chart a different course. Is a fossil-free path to development realistic?

events.title: Trump has started with Venezuela - but he may not stop there
events.description: The seizure of Nicolas Maduro takes the world into new territory.

events.title: Trump warns new Venezuelan leader as Maduro set to appear in court
events.description: Trump said Venezuela's interim president Delcy Rodríguez could "pay a very big price, probably bigger than Maduro" if she "doesn't do what's right".

events.title: Ten found guilty of cyber-bullying Brigitte Macron
events.description: A Paris court found them guilty of "malicious" bullying towards the wife of the French president.

events.title: Gaza PhD scholar is now baker to feed family, others amid Israel’s war
events.description: 'It is my mission to teach Palestinian students, even if I must build a classroom, brick by brick,' Bader Slaih says.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: US aircraft monitor tanker off Ireland in clampdown on Venezuelan oil
events.description: A dozen other ships are reportedly trying to evade Donald Trump’s naval blockade by turning off location beacons A tanker is under US military surveillance 250 miles off the coast of Ireland while about a dozen vessels with Venezuelan oil are apparently trying to evade a naval blockade in the Caribbean. The ships, which are under US sanctions, turned off transmission signals that can be used to follow them after they sailed from Venezuela, according to TankerTrackers.com. The monitoring service said satellite images showed at least four left Venezuelan waters through a route north of Isla Margarita, the country’s largest island and a popular resort. Continue reading...

events.title: What lies ahead for Venezuela after U.S. attack?
events.description: The future of Venezuela is uncertain after the U.S. capture of President Nicolas Maduro. The vice president is now in charge, but she hasn't indicated she'll fall in step with President Trump.

events.title: Germany news: Berlin still shivering amid power outage
events.description: Authorities say left-wing extremists likely carried out an arson attack that has left many Berliners without power. And alcohol can be purchased more cheaply in Germany than almost anywhere else in the EU. DW has more

events.title: Rise of the Northstar on France's soaring metal scene
events.description: French rap metal band Rise of the Northstar formed in 2008, but have been making a name for themselves over the last few years touring Europe and the Americas and collaborating with other hotly tipped French metalheads Landmvrks. They recently released their fourth album "Chapter 04: Red Falcon Super Battle! Neo Paris War!!" and sold out Paris's Olympia. Guitarist Eva B and drummer Phantom popped by the FRANCE 24 studios to chat to Marjorie Hache. Together they also check out new releases by London's Dry Cleaning, Mongolia's Uuhai and Manchester's The Cribs.

events.title: After Venezuela, Trump warns Colombia, Mexico could be next
events.description: Caption: After a US military operation in #Venezuela that led to the arrest of President Nicolas #Maduro, President Donald #Trump warned others could take place.

events.title: Papers call for 'Venezuelan resistance' after Maduro's capture
events.description: PRESS REVIEW – Monday, 5 January 2025: Venezuelan papers react to Nicolas Maduro's abduction, while the South American press is outraged. Meanwhile, in Germany, an arson attack by an extreme-left group has left thousands without power. Next, Elon Musk's AI chatbot Grok has been producing thousands of non-consensual pornographic images. Finally, the Swiss press celebrate a milestone.

events.title: Ukraine did not attack Putin's residence, says Trump
events.description: Donald Trump has said Ukraine did not target a residence belonging to Russian leader Vladimir Putin in an apparent drone attack.

events.title: 35,000 homes without power in Berlin for days after 'left-wing activists' attack power lines
events.description: About 35,000 homes are without power in Berlin after officials said left-wing extremists attacked high-voltage power lines.

events.title: New year dawns amid rubble and resolve in Gaza
events.description: As 2026 begins, residents of the Gaza Strip are confronting life in displacement camps and among the ruins of destroyed neighbourhoods – facing deep uncertainty after months of war and devastation.

events.title: Pilot dies alongside 3 nieces on wedding day in tragic Arizona helicopter crash
events.description: Tragic helicopter crash kills pilot and his three nieces on his wedding day. Family devastated as celebratory flight turns deadly in remote canyon.

events.title: Sister warned Bryan Kohberger about 'psycho killer' on the loose before his arrest: 'Be careful'
events.description: Bryan Kohberger's sister revealed she warned him about a "psycho killer" after the Idaho murders, not knowing she was speaking to the actual killer.

events.title: The Bail Project spent $91M freeing criminal suspects, including some who later committed murder
events.description: The Bail Project spent $90+ million bailing out suspects, including those who allegedly killed people after release. Multiple murders linked to the program.

events.title: Cuba's shadow in Venezuela: Havana’s intelligence and military ties exposed after Maduro raid
events.description: Cuba confirms 32 intelligence personnel killed in U.S. operation that seized Maduro, exposing extensive Cuban involvement in Venezuela's military systems.

events.title: Maduro capture echoes Noriega takedown that used rock music as psychological warfare against dictator
events.description: Nicolás Maduro's capture in Venezuela draws striking parallels to the dramatic 1989 U.S. operation that brought down Panamanian dictator Manuel Noriega.

events.title: Trump’s bid to commandeer Venezuela’s oil sector faces hurdles, experts say
events.description: Exploiting Latin American country's reserves faces obstacles from decrepit infrastructure to leadership uncertainty.

events.title: Venezuela’s acting president meets cabinet ministers
events.description: Venezuela’s interim president Delcy Rodriguez met with the country’s cabinet of ministers after Maduro's abduction.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Guinea’s junta chief elected president after opposition boycott
events.description: Mamady Doumbouya reneged on promise not to stand and hand west African country back to civilian rule The head of Guinea’s junta, Mamady Doumbouya, who had pledged not to run for office after seizing power four years ago, has been elected president after the country’s electoral commission said he had secured a sweeping majority of the vote. Doumbouya, 41, faced eight rivals for the presidency but the main opposition leaders were barred from running and had urged a boycott of the vote held over the weekend. Continue reading...

events.title: Who is in charge of Venezuela? And, what to expect from Maduro's court appearance
events.description: The U.S. forces' capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife in Caracas has left many people with questions. Here's what we know so far, including who is running the country.

events.title: Trump claims U.S. will 'run' Venezuela, but there are no troops in the country
events.description: What's next for the U.S. engagement in Venezuela? President Trump says the U.S. will run the country for now, but there are no American troops or diplomats in the country.

events.title: Venezuelans react to U.S. capture of Maduro and the future of their country
events.description: Three Venezuelans react to the U.S. operation that removed Nicolas Maduro from power and what U.S. involvement might mean in the long run.

events.title: India: Gig workers fight for fair treatment and benefits
events.description: Millions of informal workers in India are heavily dependent on app-based platforms, with their livelihoods on the line as they negotiate the country's gig economy.

events.title: Holocaust survivor Eva Schloss dies at 96
events.description: King Charles III paid tribute to the Auschwitz survivor, saying he was "privileged and proud" to have known her. Austrian-born Schloss fled her home country to the Netherlands, where she would later meet Anne Frank.

events.title: AFCON 2025: Mali beat Tunisia on penalties after epic turnaround
events.description: What was largely a slow game between Mali and Tunisia quickly turned into one of the most exciting AFCON encounters so far as Tunisia's Chaouat and Mali's Sinayoko scored on either side of the pitch. With no team able to break the deadlock in extra time, the match went to penalties in which Tunisia were punished for failing to capitalise on the disadvantage of the Eagles, who were reduced to 10 men from 26 minutes in.

events.title: Myanmar's government releases over 6,100 prisoners on independence anniversary
events.description: Myanmar’s military government has granted amnesty to more than 6,100 prisoners and has reduced other inmates’ sentences to mark the 78th anniversary of the country's independence from Britain

events.title: Captured Venezuelan dictator Maduro faces New York federal judge after dramatic palace raid
events.description: Dethroned Venezuelan dictator Nicolas Maduro faces arraignment in New York federal court Monday on drug trafficking charges after dramatic U.S. capture.

events.title: Maduro and 'Lady Macbeth’ Cilia Flores marriage spells 'worst case' custody scenario
events.description: Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and Cilia Flores face "worst-case scenario" in U.S. custody according to expert, with federal indictments on drug and weapons charges.

events.title: North Korea test-launches hypersonic missile system in front of Kim, nation says
events.description: Kim Jong Un oversaw hypersonic missile tests as North Korea ramped up weapons displays ahead of a major political conference, state media reported.

events.title: Maduro met Chinese envoy hours before US capture from Caracas as Beijing slams operation
events.description: Venezuela's dictator Nicolás Maduro was captured by U.S. forces and flown out of the country hours after meeting Chinese envoy to Latin America, Qiu Xiaoqi.

events.title: 'We need Greenland': Trump repeats threat to annex Danish territory
events.description: The US president has repeatedly said he wants the island to become a part of the US.

events.title: Raw emotions as mourners attend Mass for Swiss bar fire victims
events.description: There are tears and hugs at a special Mass for the victims of the blaze on New Year’s Eve.

events.title: Video shows Maduro's arrival in US and journey into custody
events.description: The Venezuelan president is in custody in New York after he was captured during US strikes on Saturday.

events.title: Patients evacuated after Russian strike hits Kyiv clinic
events.description: A Russian overnight strike hit a medical facility in Kyiv, killing at least one person and injuring several others.

events.title: US ‘adapt, shrink or die’ terms for $2bn aid pot will mean UN bowing down to Washington, say experts
events.description: Afghanistan and Yemen excluded from list of 17 priority countries chosen by Trump administration to receive aid laden with demands The $2bn (£1.5bn) of aid the US pledged this week may have been hailed as “bold and ambitious” by the UN but could be the “nail in the coffin” in changing to a shrunken, less flexible aid system dominated by Washington’s political priorities, aid experts fear. After a year of deep cuts in aid budgets by the US and European countries, the announcement of new money for the humanitarian system is a source of some relief, but experts are deeply concerned about demands that the US has imposed on how the money should be managed and where it can go. Continue reading...

events.title: Venezuelans describe the day after U.S. strikes
events.description: A day after Saturday's U.S. strikes, Venezuelans describe fear, confusion, and long lines for fuel and food.

events.title: Switzerland bar fire: All victims of New Year's fire identified
events.description: More than half of those who died at a Swiss ski resort celebrating the New Year were under 18 years of age, with two as young as 14. Switzerland will hold a day of mourning on Friday in memory of the victims.

events.title: British teenager confirmed dead after Swiss bar fire - as all 40 victims are identified
events.description: A teenager with British citizenship has been confirmed dead after a fire at a bar in Switzerland - as officials say all 40 victims have been identified.

events.title: Iran has been shaken by a series of protests over the past 50 years. Here's a look at them
events.description: Over the past 50 years, Iran has been shaken by a series of protests

events.title: Gaza aid lifelines under strain as winter worsens
events.description: Humanitarian partners in the Gaza Strip are struggling to reach hundreds of thousands of vulnerable people as winter storms batter damaged homes and temporary shelters.

events.title: ‘Mind chess,’ not threats, convinced real-life Sopranos mobster to cooperate: retired FBI agent
events.description: How the FBI cracked the real-life crime family behind HBO's "The Sopranos" using one shocking arrest to bring down the entire DeCavalcante organization.

events.title: UK confirms joint airstrike targeting suspected ISIS weapons facility in Syria
events.description: British and French aircraft struck an underground ISIS facility in Syria believed to be used for weapons storage. RAF Typhoon jets targeted the site north of Palmyra.

events.title: South Korea's Lee Jae Myung meets China's Xi as he seeks to reset ties
events.description: Trade, regional security and Beijing's unofficial ban on Korean pop culture are on the agenda.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Weather tracker: Arctic air grips Europe as severe winds batter Corsica
events.description: Subzero temperatures, heavy snowfall and powerful gusts mark a harsh start to 2026 for many It has been a cold start to the year across much of Europe, particularly in central regions, where temperatures dropped to double-digit negatives. Heavy snowfall hit parts of eastern and central Europe on New Year’s Eve, notably in Poland and Ukraine, with similar conditions across the Alps on the first few days of the year. The cold is likely to continue this week as an Arctic air mass sinks south across Europe, pulling temperatures well below the seasonal average outside south-east Europe. Temperatures are expected to fall widely by about 5C (41F) below average, with some areas – such as parts of central and north-eastern Europe – up to 10C lower than the norm. When wind chill is taken into account, it will feel even colder. Continue reading...

events.title: Kim Jong-un’s daughter visits state mausoleum, fuelling speculation she will be next North Korean ruler
events.description: Kim Ju-ae has been making increasingly prominent appearances in state media over the past three years The daughter of the North Korean ruler, Kim Jong-un, who is likely being prepared as his successor has accompanied her parents on her first public visit to the Kumsusan mausoleum to pay respects to former leaders, ahead of an event that could see her succession formalised. Photos from state news agency KCNA showed Kim Jong-un accompanied by his wife, Ri Sol-ju, and senior officials on the visit on 1 January, with Ju-ae between her parents in the main hall of the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun. Continue reading...

events.title: NewJeans member Danielle sued for millions after bitter feud with K-pop record label
events.description: Ador terminated the Australian-born singer’s contract on Monday and is now suing her, a family member and the band’s former producer The K-pop record label Ador is suing a former member of megaband NewJeans for millions in damages, it has announced, a day after removing her from the group following a year-long dispute that saw the band allege mistreatment and attempt to leave their contract. The compensation suit against Danielle Marsh, a 20-year-old Australian-born singer, comes months after a Seoul district court ruled that NewJeans’ five members must honour their contracts with Ador, whose parent company Hybe is also behind the K-pop sensation BTS. The band’s contract runs until 2029. Continue reading...

events.title: Drake and livestreamer Adin Ross accused of using online casino money to artificially inflate streams in class action case
events.description: US class action alleges Stake’s anonymised design enabled rapper to fund automated streams on music platforms Drake and American livestreamer Adin Ross have been accused in a US civil case of using online casino money to pay for automated streams in a bid to artificially inflate the singer’s royalties and popularity on music streaming platforms. No one has been charged criminally with regard to the allegations in the lawsuit. Two women in the US state Virginia have filed a class action seeking US$5m from e-casino Stake.com, the celebrities and another Australian internet personality for alleged breaches of Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations (Rico) and consumer protection laws. Continue reading...

events.title: Former State Department official discusses the future of Venezuela
events.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Kevin Whitaker, former U.S. ambassador to Colombia and former U.S. deputy chief of mission in Venezuela, about the U.S. raid on Caracas and engagement in Venezuela.

events.title: In Venezuela, interim president Delcy Rodriguez takes helm
events.description: As uncertainty simmers in Venezuela, interim President Delcy Rodríguez has taken the place of her ally President Nicolás Maduro, captured by the United States in a nighttime military operation, and offered “to collaborate” with the Trump administration in what could be a seismic shift in relations between the adversary governments. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Caracas, Noris Argotte Soto.

events.title: Macron says France ‘does not approve’ of US method to overthrow Maduro
events.description: President Emmanuel Macron on Monday stated that while the "method" used by the US to capture Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro was "neither supported nor approved" by France, Maduro was "a dictator" whose departure was "good news for Venezuelans". His comment followed an initial reaction that Venezuelans "can only rejoice" at Maduro's overthrow, which drew widespread criticism.

events.title: US actions in Venezuela ‘constitute a dangerous precedent’: Guterres
events.description: The UN Secretary-General António Guterres has said he is “deeply alarmed” over the standoff between the United States and Venezuela in recent months, which culminated on Saturday morning in the capture of President Nicolás Maduro by US special forces.

events.title: Results expected 5 January after landmark elections in Central African Republic
events.description: Voting proceeded largely as planned in the Central African Republic’s first-ever combined presidential, legislative, regional and municipal elections, and ballot counting is now complete, the UN peacekeeping mission (MINUSCA) said on Wednesday, with results expected to be announced on 5 January.

events.title: University of Illinois hosted state-funded committee meeting where professors advocated for reparations
events.description: University of Illinois professors advocate for collective reparations at Illinois meeting, calling for community payments beyond individual compensation.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Access to RSS feeds is rejected
events.description: Your large amount of concurrent requests for RSS data causes problems. Use the API or contact ops@reliefweb.int

events.title: What to make of Israel's military plans with Greece, Cyprus
events.description: Cyprus, Greece and Israel are set to step up joint military exercises and training. Turkey seems more concerned about the two EU members' growing procurement of advanced weapons systems from Israel.

events.title: Greenland says 'no more fantasies about annexation' after Trump remarks
events.description: Greenland's leader declared "enough is enough," and Denmark's allies in Europe affirmed that the Arctic island's future must be determined by its people, rebuffing ​renewed remarks by US President Donald Trump about acquiring the vast territory. Analysis by Clovis Casali, FRANCE 24 reporter.

events.title: Israel shuts door on Turkey in Gaza as Trump praises Erdogan, plays down clash
events.description: Israel is blocking any Turkish military role in Gaza as President Donald Trump praises Turkey's president and works to manage rising tensions over Gaza, Syria and other issues in region.

events.title: Maduro's presumed successor, Venezuelan Vice President Delcy Rodriguez, is possibly in Russia: report
events.description: Venezuelan Vice President Delcy Rodriguez, the presumed successor to captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, is in Russia, according to a report.

events.title: Abducted Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro taken to NYC courthouse
events.description: Abducted Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro was spotted while he was transferred to a New York City courthouse.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Nicolas Maduro transferred to NYC court to face narcotrafficking charges
events.description: Nicolas #Maduro was transferred on January 5 from his Brooklyn prison in New York City to Manhattan for his first US court appearance since his capture on January 3, 2026. The deposed Venezuelan leader faces charges of drug trafficking, which he could face life in prison for if convicted.

events.title: From Caracas 'fort' to New York court: Maduro's capture in pictures and maps
events.description: Follow the operation to seize the Venezuelan president through photos, satellite images and maps.

events.title: Bluefin tuna fetches record $3.2m at Tokyo auction
events.description: The 243kg fish went to a man known as the Tuna King, who said "the year's first tuna brings good luck".

events.title: Who is Cilia Flores, Venezuela's first lady seized by the US?
events.description: Long seen as a powerful figure, Flores has also faced allegations of corruption and nepotism.

events.title: Thousands stranded across Europe as Greece airspace disrupted
events.description: A fault with radio communications caused air traffic controllers to temporarily suspend arrivals and departures.

events.title: Bowen: Trump's action could set precedent for authoritarian powers across globe
events.description: Trump seems to believe he makes the rules and others cannot have the same privileges.

events.title: The French university where spies go for training
events.description: Sciences Po Saint-Germain near Paris trains current French secret agents and potential new recruits.

events.title: India wants more passenger jets. Can it also build them?
events.description: India’s aviation boom, delivery delays and a Russia tie-up revive the long-running question of building planes at home.

events.title: Israeli settlers consume water seven times more than Palestinians
events.description: A Palestinian water expert says settlers are using an 'apartheid' tactic to force Palestinians out of their land.

events.title: Bangladesh bans IPL broadcast amid growing tensions with India
events.description: The move comes after star Bangladesh fast bowler Mustafizur Rahman was dropped by his IPL team on the BCCI's directives.

events.title: Why was Ruben Amorim sacked as Man United manager?
events.description: Portuguese manager Ruben Amorim exits Manchester United after just 14 months in charge. Here's all to know.

events.title: Ten found guilty of gender cyberbullying France First Lady Brigitte Macron
events.description: President Emmanuel Macron’s wife has faced intense harassment on social media that she was born a man.

events.title: Who’ll be most worried by the US abduction of Maduro?
events.description: The abduction of Venezuela’s Nicolas Maduro has heightened fears that the US could intervene in other countries.

events.title: Syrian delegation meets Israelis in Paris amid sovereignty breaches
events.description: Talks have been continuing on and off to reach a security deal between the sides for months.

events.title: Venezuela after Maduro: Oil, power and the limits of intervention
events.description: For oil markets, Venezuela is a footnote in an age of abundance. For Middle East, the US move is a dangerous reminder.

events.title: Thousands of forced disappearances under Hasina rule in Bangladesh: Inquiry
events.description: The Commission of Inquiry on Enforced Disappearances members says disappearances were 'primarily political'.

events.title: What will happen to parts of Venezuela’s economy affected by US sanctions?
events.description: Economist Francisco Rodriguez: regaining access to blocked assets will be essential for Venezuela’s economic recovery

events.title: Amorim sacked by Man United; Fletcher named as interim manager
events.description: Ruben Amorim's tumultuous reign as manager comes to an end after 14 months, as academy coach Darren Fletcher takes over.

events.title: Mixed messages from Trump administration on US ‘running’ Venezuela
events.description: Donald Trump claimed the US will ‘run’ Venezuela, his top diplomat Marco Rubio insisted the US would not be in charge.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: 'Tuna King' pays record £2.4m for giant bluefin at Tokyo auction
events.description: Kiyoshi Kimura will turn prized 243kg fish into sushi rolls selling for £2.4o at his restaurant chain A sushi entrepreneur has paid a record 510.3m yen (£2.4m) for a giant bluefin tuna at a prestigious auction in Tokyo’s main fish market. Kiyoshi Kimura, who styles himself the “Tuna King”, paid the top price for the 243kg (536lbs) specimen, which was caught off Japan’s northern coast. Continue reading...

events.title: NSW residents urged to check if they are owed share of $300m in unclaimed money
events.description: Millions of dollars held by Revenue NSW includes uncashed cheques, refunds and other payments owed to individuals who may have died or changed address Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast New South Wales residents are being urged to check if they are owed some of the $300m sitting in Revenue NSW’s unclaimed money pool. The pool includes funds from overpayments, uncashed cheques, dividends, refunds, and other amounts owed to individuals the government has not been able to contact. Continue reading...

events.title: Why a power plant is strategically important in the talks between Russia and Ukraine
events.description: NPR's A Martinez talks to Henry Sokolski of the Nonproliferation Policy Education Center about the Zaporizhzhia power plant and its importance in the peace talks between Russia and Ukraine.

events.title: The rise and fall of Nicolás Maduro
events.description: The rise of Venezuela's deposed president, Nicolás Maduro, was slow, beginning in youth politics and shaped by the mentorship of Hugo Chávez. Maduro's fall, too, unfolded over years.

events.title: Can Germany escape its economic slump in 2026?
events.description: After years of economic downturn, the German economy desperately needs a 2026 boost. Yet despite massive government spending pledges, optimism is fading among economists.

events.title: Massive bluefin tuna nets over $3 million at Tokyo auction
events.description: Kiyoshi Kimura broke his own record for a giant bluefin tuna at the celebratory start-of-year auction at Tokyo's Toyosu fish market. He said customers would pay standard prices despite him splashing out.

events.title: France: 10 found guilty of cyberbullying Brigitte Macron
events.description: Ten people were accused of spreading false information about the French first lady, including about her gender and sexuality.

events.title: Uncertain future in Venezuela, as Delcy Rodriguez sworn in as president
events.description: Venezuela's former leader Nicolas Maduro is due in a New York court on Monday ⁠to face drug charges while the UN was to scrutinize the legality of US President Donald Trump's extraordinary operation to capture him. In the meantime, the situation in Venezuela remains very uncertain, on both the short and long term. Analysis by Tiziano Breda, senior analyst of Latin America and the Caribbean at ACLED, in Rome.

events.title: AFCON 2025: Mali and Senegal come from behind to set up quarter-final clash
events.description: Despite playing with 10 men for 100 minutes, Mali held on to beat Tunisia on penalties and book their spot in the next round. They'll meet Senegal, who also came from behind to beat Sudan 3-1, with Sadio Mané becoming the player with the most assists in AFCON history. We also take a look at hosts Morocco's preparation ahead of their clash with Tanzania, while South Africa will face Cameroon in Sunday's other fixture.

events.title: Nicolas Maduro walked from a helicopter to the courthouse: "Its all part of the spectacle"
events.description: Ousted Venezuelan president Nicolas Maduro was en route to a New York courthouse early Monday, days after being seized in Caracas in a shock US military operation. Maduro, 63, was shackled and accompanied by a number of heavily armed law enforcement officers. He was flown by helicopter to New York, where he was placed in an armored car. According to Philip Turle, this images are part of the US's spectacle to display its power.

events.title: Nicolas Maduro arrives at New York courthouse to face drug charges
events.description: Venezuela's deposed leader Nicolas ⁠Maduro arrives in a New York court on Monday to face drug charges while the U.N. was to scrutinize the legality of U.S. President Donald Trump's extraordinary operation to capture him.

events.title: Venezuela's acting president Delcy Rodriguez invites Donald Trump to "collaborate"
events.description: Venezuela's deposed leader Nicolas Maduro was due in a New York court on Monday ⁠to face drug charges while the U.N. was to scrutinize the legality of U.S. President Donald Trump's extraordinary operation to capture him. In the biggest U.S. intervention in Latin America since the 1989 invasion of Panama, Special Forces swooped into Caracas on helicopters at the weekend to smash through Maduro's security cordon and nab him at the door of a safe room. Maduro loyalists, including his vice-president Delcy Rodriguez, remain in charge of Venezuela, first spitting defiance then pivoting to possible cooperation. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Washington DC, Fraser Jackson.

events.title: Ten guilty of cyber bullying France's first lady after false transgender claims
events.description: Ten people have been found guilty of cyber bullying France's first lady Brigitte Macron.

events.title: Humiliation for Maduro as he is transferred to US court
events.description: Humiliation is at the heart of this and it showed.

events.title: Massive bluefin tuna sells for record £2.4m
events.description: A massive 243kg (535lb) bluefin tuna has been sold for a record 510 million yen (£2.4m) to a Japanese sushi restaurant.

events.title: Finland's battle against fake news starts in preschool classrooms
events.description: Finland has been fighting fake news by teaching media literacy to children as young as 3

events.title: Driving instructors teach students to dodge danger on Zimbabwe roads
events.description: Zimbabwe’s driving lessons have shifted from test prep to survival

events.title: Holocaust survivor Eva Schloss, stepsister of Anne Frank, dies at 96
events.description: Auschwitz survivor Eva Schloss, stepsister of Anne Frank, has died at 96

events.title: Paris court finds 10 guilty of cyberbullying France’s first lady Brigitte Macron
events.description: A Paris court has found 10 people guilty of cyberbullying France’s first lady, Brigitte Macron, by spreading false online claims about her gender and sexuality, including allegations she was born a man

events.title: Photos show people in Lebanon enjoying winter weather on the slopes
events.description: People in Lebanon enjoyed winter weather and snow as they took to the slopes at the Mzaar-Kfardebian ski resort on Saturday. This is a photo gallery curated by AP photo editors.

events.title: India's top court denies bail to 2 Muslim activists after 5 years in jail without trial
events.description: India’s Supreme Court has denied bail to two Muslim student activists, Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam, who have been detained for years without trial

events.title: South Korean movie star Ahn Sung-ki, dubbed 'The Nation's Actor,' dies at 74
events.description: South Korean film star Ahn Sung-ki, whose prolific career earned him the nickname “The Nation's Actor,” has died

events.title: Syrian and Israeli officials set to resume US-mediated talks in Paris
events.description: Syrian and Israeli officials are set to resume U.S.-mediated talks in Paris, aiming for a security agreement to ease tensions

events.title: Vatican claims a Holy Year success with 33 million pilgrims
events.description: The Vatican has given a final accounting of its 2025 Holy Year

events.title: UN chief condemns Israeli amendments targeting UNRWA operations
events.description: The UN Secretary-General has condemned amendments adopted by Israel’s Knesset to a law aimed at ceasing the operations of the UN agency assisting Palestine refugees (UNRWA), saying the measures must be immediately repealed.

events.title: General Assembly approves $3.45 billion UN regular budget for 2026
events.description: The General Assembly has approved a $3.45 billion regular budget for the United Nations for 2026, following weeks of intensive negotiations and one of the Organization’s most important reform initiatives, UN80.

events.title: LIVE: General Assembly decides on 2026 UN budget
events.description: Follow our live coverage as the General Assembly and its Fifth Committee meet today to finalize negotiations and vote on the United Nations’ regular budget for 2026. The Fifth Committee is responsible for administrative and budgetary matters, including the Organization’s finances and staffing. UN News app users can click here and go here for all our in-depth meeting coverage.

events.title: Maduro, wife face 'worst-case scenario' as Trump vows to govern Venezuela and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: Venezuelan leader Maduro, wife arrive at Brooklyn detention facility after capture by US forces
events.description: Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and his wife arrived at the Metropolitan Detention Center in New York Saturday night and face drug conspiracy charges after being captured by U.S. forces Saturday.

events.title: Maduro jailed at New York detention center that held Diddy, Ghislaine Maxwell and Sam Bankman-Fried
events.description: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro will be detained at MDC Brooklyn, the same prison housing Luigi Mangione and where Diddy and Ghislaine Maxwell were held.

events.title: US military details timeline of operation to capture Maduro, revealing more than 150 aircraft involved
events.description: Joint Chiefs Gen. Dan Caine provides details about the high-stakes military operation to capture Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro that was planned for months.

events.title: Police seek suspect after dentist and wife found shot dead at home while 2 young children are unharmed
events.description: Columbus dentist Spencer Tepe and wife Monique found shot dead in their home just weeks before their fifth wedding anniversary. Two children unharmed.

events.title: Trump says Cuba is ‘ready to fall’ after capture of Venezuela’s Maduro
events.description: President Trump says Cuba is “ready to fall" after the U.S. operation that captured Venezuela’s Nicolás Maduro, cutting off a key economic and security lifeline to Havana.

events.title: Zelenskyy reacts to Maduro arrest: US 'knows what to do next'
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy reacts to Nicolás Maduro's capture, suggesting the U.S. "knows what to do next" with dictators after military operation.

events.title: Venezuelan dissident outlines risks and opportunities as Venezuela enters post-Maduro era
events.description: Hope emerges for Venezuela's future as experts discuss rebuilding institutions and creating stable democracy after years of authoritarian control.

events.title: Iran and Maduro ties suffer major blow following US operation and capture of Venezuelan dictator
events.description: Venezuela President Nicolás Maduro's capture deals devastating blow to Iran's Western Hemisphere interests, experts say, weakening Tehran's anti-American alliance in South America.

events.title: What is Delta Force and what does it do? Inside the elite US Army unit that captured Maduro
events.description: What is Delta Force? President Donald Trump confirms the elite U.S. Army unit led the operation that captured Venezuela’s Nicolás Maduro.

events.title: Maduro’s fall sparks suspicion of betrayal inside Venezuela’s ruling elite
events.description: Maduro’s sudden removal raises questions of betrayal, military loyalty and what comes next as Venezuela braces for a dangerous fight over power.

events.title: Maduro gave car interview about possible Trump olive branch days before he was captured by US
events.description: Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro was captured by U.S. forces days after he discussed possible drug trafficking deal negotiations with President Donald Trump.

events.title: María Corina Machado, Venezuelan opposition urge military to back power transfer after Maduro capture
events.description: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado calls for military to abandon Maduro after President Donald Trump announced the president's capture by U.S. forces.
